No denial of Section 80P deduction to 'primary agricultural credit societies' even if it gives loan to non-members holds Supreme Court.  #IncomeTax
The limited object of Section 80P(4) is to exclude co-operative banks that function at par with other commercial banks i.e. which lend money to members of the public;   #IncomeTax

once Section 80P(4) is out of harm's way, Primary agricultural credit societies are entitled to the benefit of the deduction contained in Section 80P(2)(a)(i), notwithstanding that they may also be giving loans to their members which are not related to agriculture.   #IncomeTax

In case, it is found that there are instances of loans being given to non-members, profits attributable to such loans obviously cannot be deducted.  - Mavilayi Service Co-operative Bank Ltd. v. Commissioner of Income Tax, [2021] 123 taxmann.com 161 (SC)  #IncomeTax

#AatmanirbharBharatKaBudget The Budget 2021-22 aims to ease the lives of senior citizens. Senior citizens who are 75 years of age & above and have only pension & interest income are exempted from filing their Income Tax return.

#AatmanirbharBharatKaBudget To ease compliance for taxpayers, the Govt has reduced the time for Income Tax proceedings. The time-limit for re-opening of assessment has been decreased to 3 years from the present 6 years.

#AatmanirbharBharatKaBudget The budget announces a voluntary vehicle scrapping policy, to phase out old and unfit vehicles. This will help in encouraging fuel-efficient, environment-friendly vehicles, thereby reducing vehicular pollution and oil import bill.

#AatmanirbharBharatKaBudget The Budget has deepened the gas network in the country. The Ujjwala scheme is extended to cover 1 crore more beneficiaries and an independent gas transport system operator will be set up to facilitate book and transport capacity for all.

#AatmanirbharBharatKaBudget The budget strengthens the Sankalp of Nation First, Doubling Farmer's Income, Strong Infrastructure, Healthy India, Good Governance, Opportunities for Youth, Education for All, Women Empowerment, and Inclusive Development, among others.

#AatmanirbharBharatKaBudget The budget outlines six pillars to strengthen the vision of Atmanirbharta- health & wellbeing, capital & infrastructure, inclusive development, reinvigorating human capital, innovation, R&D, and minimum government & maximum governance.

#AatmanirbharBharatKaBudget India's first-ever digital budget was presented in 2021. A first of this new decade, this budget provides every opportunity for our economy to rise and capture the pace that it needs for sustainable growth in a post-pandemic world.

The Government of India presented the Union Budget 2021 on February 1, 2021. This year, the focus of the budget will be on off-budget borrowings so as to reduce the Fiscal Deficit.The loans that are taken by any public institution and not by the Centre directly are called as

the "Off-Budget Borrowings". The public institution borrows on the directions of the central government.The liability of the loan is not formally on the Centre and is not included in the national fiscal deficit. Thus, it helps in keeping the fiscal deficit of the country
within acceptable limits.next time when any government claim to keep fiscal deficit in controll. This will be reason.
